headline.main: From Another Correspondent.; THE HEALTH OF JUDGE DOUGLAS PRESIDENTIAL PROSPECTS.

docs.snippet: A communication was received from the Secretary of the Treasury, in reply to the resolution of the Senate calling for information as to the unexpended balance of the amount appropriated under the treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, to pay the claims of...
docs.lead_paragraph: A communication was received from the Secretary of the Treasury, in reply to the resolution of the Senate calling for information as to the unexpended balance of the amount appropriated under the treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo, to pay the claims of American citizen. The balance is stated at something over two hundred thousand dollars. The communication was ordered to be printed.

docs.snippet: The Union meeting at the Capitol to-night was attended by fully four thousand persons, while an untold number were excluded from the great outer hall of the Capitol by inability to obtain admittance. The hall was packed as closely as men could stand...

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; UNION MEETINGS. Great Demonstration at Albany. SPEECHES OF MESSRS. GARRET Y. LANSING, EX-GOV. SEYMOUR, HENRY J. RAYMOND AND OTHERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Union meeting at the Capitol to-night was attended by fully four thousand persons, while an untold number were excluded from the great outer hall of the Capitol by inability to obtain admittance. The hall was packed as closely as men could stand the speakers occupying the landing at the top of the stairs leading to the Senate Chamber.

docs.snippet: The Board of Aldermen last evening adopted a resolution, offered by Alderman CORNELL, directing that the rooms of the Fourth District Court, corner of Third-avenue and Fifth-street, be assigned to the seventeenth Precinct Police for sleeping-rooms,...

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; BOARD OF ALDERMEN. INSPECTION OF STEAM BOILERS REPORTS IN FAVOR OF ADDING $191,000 TO THE TAX LEVY THE PERRY LEASES COMPENSATION FOR THE COMMON COUNCIL.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen last evening adopted a resolution, offered by Alderman CORNELL, directing that the rooms of the Fourth District Court, corner of Third-avenue and Fifth-street, be assigned to the seventeenth Precinct Police for sleeping-rooms, and that the Street Commissioner make the necessary alterations and repairs.

docs.snippet: Mr. Christopher Dresser, the lecturer on botany to the Department of Science and Art of the Privy Council for Education, South Kensington Museum, has been presented with the degree of Doctor of Philosophy, for his botanical discoveries, by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Christopher Dresser, the lecturer on botany to the Department of Science and Art of the Privy Council for Education, South Kensington Museum, has been presented with the degree of Doctor of Philosophy, for his botanical discoveries, by the University of Jena.

headline.main: AFFAIRS AT ALBANY.; A NEW MEASURE FOR CITY RAILROADS. The Freight Bill in the House. LEGISLATION FAIRLY IN MOTION.

docs.lead_paragraph: In executive session, to-day, the following appointments were sent in by the Governor, and confirmed: For Superintendent of the Insurance Department, WM. BARNES; Canal Appraiser, THOMAS B. CARROLL, in place of Mr. HULL, of Steuben, whose time expires. No Harbor Masters or Port Wardens were sent in to-day.

docs.snippet: ANOTHER MYSTERIOUS CASE.--One week ago last Saturday, a man named McNAMARA, residing at No. 202 Columbia-street, South Brooklyn, took a gun and went into Tiffany-place, just at the rear of his residence, for the purpose of killing a dog, which had...
docs.lead_paragraph: ANOTHER MYSTERIOUS CASE.--One week ago last Saturday, a man named McNAMARA, residing at No. 202 Columbia-street, South Brooklyn, took a gun and went into Tiffany-place, just at the rear of his residence, for the purpose of killing a dog, which had bitten one of his children. Several hours after this he was brought home in an insensible condition by members of the family owning the dog.
